member.name: T:Microsoft.Dss.Services.Samples.KinectUI.FramePreProcessor
member.summary: Responsibility of this class is to take a raw frame and turn it into a format that can be consumed by UI w/o having to do any service calls in the process For Video - it menas nothing to do (as RawFrame's planar image for RGB is directly consumable by UI) For Depth - it means turning Kinect Depth frame into a grayscale (with optional coloring of players) For Skeletons - it means pre-calculating all Joint positions and storing those in JointPoints container such that UI only needs to connect the dots

member.summary: Blue byte offset in Color stream.

member.summary: Red byte offset in Color stream.

member.summary: The skeleton data, the color image data, and the depth data are based on different coordinate systems. To show consistent images from all three streams in the sampleâ€™s display window, we need to convert coordinates in skeleton space to image space by following steps ///
